abstract.text: An object that provides environmental lighting information for a specific area of space in a world-tracking AR session.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Environment textures depict the view in all directions from a specific point in a scene. In 3D asset rendering, environment textures are the basis for image-based lighting algorithms where surfaces can realistically reflect light from their surroundings. ARKit can generate environment textures during an AR session using camera imagery, allowing SceneKit or a custom-rendering engine to provide realistic image-based lighting for virtual objects in your AR experience.
To enable texture map generation for an AR session, set the
environment texturing, you identify points in the scene for which you want light probe texture maps by creating
objects and adding them to the session.
environment texturing, ARKit automatically creates, positions, and adds
In both cases, ARKit automatically generates environment textures as the session collects camera imagery. Use a delegate method such as
to find out when a texture is available, and access it from the anchor’s
If you display AR content using
texture maps and uses them to light the scene.

abstract.text: Integrate hardware sensing features to produce augmented reality apps and games.
An object that specifies the position and orientation of an item in the physical environment.
Support for custom anchor subclasses.
Estimated environmental lighting information associated with a captured video frame in a face-tracking AR session.
An object that provides environmental lighting information for a specific area of space in a world-tracking AR session.
A cube-map texture that represents the view in all directions from the probe anchor’s position.
The area around the anchor’s position that contains the texture.
Creates a new anchor object with a descriptive name.
Creates a new environment probe anchor.
Estimated scene lighting information associated with a captured video frame in an AR session.
A view that blends virtual 3D content from SceneKit into your augmented reality experience.
A Boolean value that specifies whether ARKit creates and updates SceneKit lights in the view’s scene.
Tells the delegate that the session has adjusted the properties of one or more anchors.
The framework automatically determines when and where to generate environment textures.
The framework generates environment textures only for probe anchors you explicitly add to the session.
An option that determines how the framework generates environment textures.
Use ARKit to generate environment probe textures from camera imagery and render reflective virtual objects.

abstract.text: A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
